cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles SSW of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the Texas–Louisiana coast, then turning north and tracking inland toward the lower Mississippi and Ohio Valleys
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-west Louisiana / upper Texas coast (near the TX-LA border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches include Michigan; Tropical-storm watch area confined to the northern Gulf Coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from San Luis Pass, TX eastward to the Alabama-Florida border including metropolitan New Orleans and Lake Pontchartrain.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Texas coast eastward across Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (Detroit was not listed in the wind-probability table)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: No (forecast totals near Detroit are expected to stay below 4 inches)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (Great Lakes port, no appreciable surge from Cindy)
weather_observation.wind: Low risk of tropical-storm-force winds; any gusts expected to remain below gale force.
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture could bring 1–2 inches of rain late 24–25 Jun, causing minor ponding but no major flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief thunderstorm or low-end tornado threat cannot be ruled out as remnants pass south of the Great Lakes, but overall operational impact at the port remains minimal.
